title: West Virginia is heavily reliant on coal. And has seen dramatic floods. What do residents think about climate change?
description: West Virginia continues to grapple with the effects of the climate crisis after the town of Clendenin was nearly wiped off the map in 2016 in what was dubbed the "thousand year flood." CNN's Rene Marsh reports as Sen. Joe Manchin (D-WV) continues to fight legislation aimed at combating severe weather.

title: Grammy-award winning singer surprises street performer
description: What are the chances? A street performer in Boston was singing a John Legend song when she spotted him in the crowd. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: 'Upsetting and disturbing': Katie Couric discussing Matt Lauer revelations
description: Katie Couric returned to "Today" promoting her new memoir, "Going There." She discussed her relationship with former co-anchor Matt Lauer, who was fired after complaints of "inappropriate sexual behavior."

title: 96-year-old Nazi war crimes suspect who absconded last month now goes on trial
description: The trial of a 96-year-old former Nazi concentration camp secretary has finally began in Germany, weeks after she went on the run just before she was due in court.

title: US CDC places Singapore at highest travel risk for Covid-19
description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has added one new location to its list of "very high" risk travel destinations this week.

title: Haiti gang wants $17M ransom for kidnapped American and Canadian missionaries
description: The gang that kidnapped a group of 17 American and Canadian missionaries in Haiti has asked for $1 million each for their release, a top Haitian official said Monday, according to the Wall Street Journal.

title: Vaccinated people dying from Covid doesn't mean vaccines don't work
Dead mouse at school board member's doorstep. Hear her response
description: Carolyn Waibel was a school board member in St. Charles, Illinois, working to maintain Covid-19 mandates in schools until the "unrelenting harassment," vandalism to her home and a dead mouse left on her doorstep pushed her to resign. CNN's Brianna Keilar speaks to Waibel about her decision.

title: 15 of the world's most spectacular airport landings
description: There's a lot to love about travel. Experiencing a new culture. Eating great food. Staying in top notch hotels... and landing in a new airport.

title: Scuba diver finds 900-year-old Crusader sword off the coast of Israel
description: A scuba diver has found a 900-year-old Crusader sword with a three-foot blade off the coast of Israel.

title: In Ukraine, Defense Secretary Austin calls on Russia to stop 'persistent cyberattacks'
description: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin on Tuesday called on Russia to stop its occupation of Crimea and to halt its "persistent cyberattacks" against the United States.

title: Of course Trump is suing the January 6 committee
description: On Monday, former President Donald Trump sued the congressional committee investigating the January 6 riot at the US Capitol in an attempt to keep the committee from getting its hands on roughly 40 documents.

title: Nathan Chen says he has grown since disappointing Pyeongchang Games
description: U.S. figure skater Nathan Chen on Monday said his disappointing performance at the Pyeongchang Games in 2018 gave him a fresh perspective on the sport.

title: FIFA 'deeply concerned' at footage of DR Congo Under-20 women's national team
description: Football's world governing body FIFA says it's "deeply concerned" at images that have recently emerged on social media of the Congolese Under-20 women's national team.

title: NBA commissioner Adam Silver hopes Kyrie Irving decides to get vaccinated against Covid-19
description: Ahead of the start of the NBA's 75th season, the sport's commissioner Adam Silver told reporter that he hopes Brooklyn Nets star Kyrie Irving gets vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: New 620-mile railway connects China and Laos
description: China's intense railway expansion has marked a new milestone with the official opening of a new track that pushes beyond its own frontiers into its southern neighbor Laos.

title: Deaths of vaccinated people like Colin Powell don't mean vaccines are ineffective, medical expert explains
What actually happened during GameStop mania?
description: In late January, there was one question on the minds of investors: How did a struggling mall-based video game retailer became Wall Street's hottest stock, seemingly overnight?

title: Quake off Greece's Karpathos shakes eastern Mediterranean
description: An earthquake struck off the Greek island of Karpathos early on Tuesday, shaking towns and cities across the eastern Mediterranean, witnesses and media said.

title: One year on, a mother reveals horror of finding dying son amid carnage at Lekki toll
description: When Adesola heard about the shooting at the Lekki toll gate in Lagos on October 20, 2020, she immediately thought of her son who had earlier left home to join the hundreds of young people protesting against police brutality at the site.

title: Toys stuck in supply chain chaos off LA coast
description: Approximately 200,000 shipping containers remain gridlocked off the coast of Los Angeles as pandemic-related disruptions continue to affect various supply chains. CNN's Vanessa Yurkevich explains how this delay is going to hurt our holiday shopping.

title: EU warns Poland it will pay for challenging common law
description: The European Commission's chief executive warned Poland on Tuesday that its challenge to the supremacy of European Union law called into question the very foundations of the 27-nation bloc and could not go unpunished.

title: The year's most stunning architectural photos revealed
description: Images of a cube-shaped office building in Berlin and a soaring Chinese skyscraper complex are among the finalists in the prestigious Architectural Photography Awards.

title: Kanye West has officially changed his name
description: Kanye West is no more. After filing paperwork to change his name, the rapper, born Kanye Omari West, finally got what he asked for, and will be legally known as "Ye."

title: Saudi Arabia to launch enormous oil themed 'extreme park'
description: Saudi Arabia may be trying to reduce its dependency on oil, but that hasn't stopped the Arabic kingdom from using its petroleum industry as inspiration for a brand new tourist attraction.

title: Man falls to death after dangling from hot air balloon in Israel
description: A man dangling from the basket of a hot air balloon fell to his death onto a road in Israel on Tuesday, police said.

title: Norway attack victims were killed by stabbings, not arrows, police say
description: The five victims of last week's attack in Norway were all stabbed to death, rather than killed by bow-and-arrow as previously thought, police said Monday.

title: WHO-led program aims to buy antiviral Covid-19 pills for $10
description: A World Health Organization-led program to ensure poorer countries get fair access to Covid-19 vaccines, tests and treatments aims to secure antiviral drugs for patients with mild symptoms for as little as $10 per course, a draft document seen by Reuters says.

title: The German striker taking the world of esports by storm
description: There is a young German forward, playing in the Bundesliga, who scores hundreds of goals every week.

title: Boris Johnson's secret COP26 weapon may have to be shame
description: It's now less than two weeks until Boris Johnson welcomes the world to Glasgow, Scotland, where he will host the COP26 international climate talks at a crucial moment in our planet's history.

title: Key Biden immigration nominee to testify amid busiest US-Mexico border in two decades
description: President Joe Biden's pick to lead US Customs and Border Protection will testify before a Senate panel Tuesday and make his case for why he should lead the border agency amid one of the busiest years in two decades on the southern border.

title: January 6 committee slated to formally advance Steve Bannon criminal contempt report Tuesday
description: The House committee investigating the January 6 US Capitol attack is expected to formally kick off the process to hold Steve Bannon, one of former President Donald Trump's closest allies, in contempt of Congress on Tuesday night when the panel is scheduled to meet and advance a referral to the Justice Department.

title: Djokovic's Australian Open title defence in doubt over vaccination status
description: Australia's Victoria state will not do special deals with unvaccinated athletes to allow them to compete at major events, an official said on Tuesday, putting Novak Djokovic's Australian Open title defence and bid for the Grand Slam record in doubt.

title: These 5 Chinese real estate developers are already in trouble
description: China's real estate crisis isn't showing any sign of letting up.

title: She drank puddle water and slept under a tree. Shocking reality for refugees crossing EU border
description: Desperate refugees are trapped between Belarus and Poland as neither country want them to stay. While some are being stopped, an increasing number have made to Germany. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen speaks to some of them at a refugee center in the German town of Eisenhuettenstadt.

title: North Korea has fired at least one ballistic missile from its east coast
description: North Korea fired at least one ballistic missile from its eastern coast on Tuesday morning, according to South Korean and Japanese officials.

title: Australia offers payments of up to $3,700 to help people leave violent partners
description: The Australian government is offering one-off payments to help people leave violent relationships.

title: Myanmar to release 5,600 prisoners held for anti-junta protests
description: Myanmar's junta has freed hundreds of political prisoners, according to state media outlet Global New Light of Myanmar on Tuesday.

title: A fully solar-powered campervan has just driven through Europe
description: Traveling along the highways of Europe, a campervan named "Stella Vita" has driven almost 2,000 kilometers (1,242 miles) without stopping for fuel or plugging in to charge.

title: India moves thousands of Kashmir migrants to secure locations after deadly attacks
description: Indian authorities have moved thousands of migrant workers in Kashmir to safer locations overnight, while hundreds have fled the Himalayan valley after a wave of targeted killings, two security officials said on Monday.

title: See the moment hundreds of political prisoners were released
description: Myanmar's junta has freed hundreds of political prisoners from Yangon's Insein prison, Reuters reported Tuesday, citing local media. It follows the junta's announcement that it would free more than 5,600 people arrested for protesting against military rule since a coup. CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

title: One year after Lekki toll gate shooting, victim's mother wants honesty from Nigerian government
description: It's been a year since Nigerian forces opened fire on peaceful protests at the Lekki toll gate in Lagos. At the time, a CNN investigation into what happened sent shock waves around the world. We found that the Nigerian army had fired live rounds into the crowd, killing and wounding several people. Witnesses also told CNN the authorities blocked ambulances from reaching the scene. Twelve months on, and a judicial hearing is finally expected to share its findings. Stephanie Busari reports.

title: Viral 'video wizard' reveals his best tricks
description: Visual effects artist Kevin Parry has always wanted to be a magician. Now, he creates "magical" videos with illusions and stop-motion animation.

title: 'Disgraceful': Don Lemon on Fox News coverage of Powell's death
description: Minutes after learning about the death of Gen. Colin Powell, Fox News used his death to share Covid-19 vaccine misinformation. CNN's Don Lemon reacts.

title: 'Not surprised:' Lawmaker reacts to Trump suing Jan.6 committee
description: Former President Donald Trump filed a lawsuit in DC District Court against the House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection and the National Archives in an effort to keep records from his presidency secret by claiming executive privilege. CNN's Wolf Blitzer and Rep. Zoe Lofgren (D-CA) discuss.

title: 13-year-old pug goes viral for his adorable daily ritual
description: A 13-year-old adopted pug has over 1.7 million followers on TikTok for his hilarious forecasts of the future. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: China reportedly tested a nuclear-capable hypersonic missile
description: Experts are concerned about China's military capabilities after a report that the country recently tested a nuclear-capable hypersonic missile. CNN's Brian Todd has more.
